title: Creepblock still terrible
body:

Also creep agro is fucked and minions can ignore you or chase you worse than the tax man.

Bad champion pathing is another exacerbater.

Sounds like you are conserving your mana/resource a bit.  If you want to practice learning the wave jump into practice tool and find how many attacks it takes to bring a minion into kill range with an ability.  Once there look to hit and kill as many minions as you can plus the enemy as your spells won't draw aggro from the minions.  Don't try to basic attack your enemy early game unless you can quickly step into a bush.  If minions can't see you they lose interest so use that to your advantage.

That larger hit box can also be paired with longer attack range.  Most Juggernaughts have the reach to stand behind minions to attack enemy minions.

If I remember correctly, Riot said that fixing something like minion blocking requires digging deep into League's code... but there's too much spaghetti down there to handle. Too much can go wrong.

"Realistically" they would have to rewrite everything. They say the opportunity cost is too immense, and so they would rather work on developing new features that have greater benefits.

Here's some info that they posted when they last tried fixing the problem: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/EWLnAleN-follow-up-pathing-aka-minion-blocking-update

Or, God forbid, they could just remove minion block entirely. It's an irritating and unnecessary "feature" held-over from the olden days of DotA. Riot made League and cleverly removed a lot of the more obtuse parts of DotA, like minion denying, to make it the game more accessible to people unfamiliar with the genre. Yet for some reason minion block has managed to stay in the game for... what like 8 years now or something? And I honestly cannot fathom why.

It is a pretty fundamental rule of design that everything should serve a purpose. You should have a good reason for every decision when making a game. But what purpose does minion block serve? There's absolutely minimal skill to it; either you randomly get caught or you don't. It's frustrating because it is extremely unclear where or how you're getting caught until you're already 2 seconds into your minion CC. 

Lets compare minion block to a mechanic that was removed for a similar feel bad reason; dodge. When Riot removed dodge from the game entirely, the reasoning was that trades shouldn't be decided by RNG and because outplaying your opponent only to watch them get away with 10 hp because they dodged your flash-auto. Dodge served an actual purpose (defense stat strong against heavy auto attackers) and yet Riot removed it basically without a second thought because of the randomness and the feelbadman moments it created. Minion block serves no purpose (punish melee characters harder than they already are? wut?) and is equally as random. Why on earth is it still in the game? Just remove it entirely and the game will be better for it.

Are you talking about ignoring unit collision? The reason why that won't be removed is because of balance. Ignoring collision with minions would make it much easier to avoid skill shots that minions can block. So for example, if you are in front of a minion, you can pass right over it instead of going around to avoid attacks. The few fractions of a second saved is enough to make a difference. Overall, I think more problems would be created than fixed. It's pretty rare in the first place that minion blocking occurs unfairly.

I agree, I find creep block to be irritating, not simply because it messes up the pathing of a great deal many champions (especially in top lane), but because that pathing often feels buggy, accidental or otherwise poorly predictable. I would like to see it gone completely, and while that request is often answered by the claim that creep block is used to balance certain champions (which ones are never specifically cited, though), I also personally don't think it should ever be a valid strategy to balance a champion by making them feel clunkier or buggier. As a side note, this is also why I'm not a fan of the recent Zoe nerf to her Q updating, because it works exactly on that principle. In this particular respect, if removing creep block were to make specific champions shoot up to excessive win rates, then I think balancing them directly as a result of that would create a much healthier situation overall. If champions were to lose counterplay entirely due to creep block, then the real problem is likely that those champions are just unhealthy to start with, and so updating their gameplay would be necessary anyway.

Jungle being way too easy, junglers heals in jungle and have  free will to do as many ganks as they want without being punished if a gank fails( to sum up jungle resources too op)

Champions lack dmgs( which make the laning phase in 1v1 non punitive, if you play safe u can never die at most u miss a bit of cs)

System of elo requires too much games to reach ur actual elo. + mmr that changes instead of same amount of point every time.

The game snowballs too hard.

I mean, that's fair, but then again that doesn't mean that all issues should be abandoned in favor of just one. Riot does tend to focus on specific issues at a time, but they don't drop everything in a single patch just to tweak one champion or item, for example. I agree that creep block isn't the end of the world, and that often criticism of any one particular issue gets framed as such on here, but I still think it's one of the many issues worth bringing to Riot's attention, particularly since it's been an ongoing problem for years.
They should just remove this so called "feature" it's just bad
